settings.title: Propane Fire Bowls
settings.subheading:
Propane fire bowls are cost-effective, safe, and gorgeous. They’re perfect for your patio, deck, and even your backyard. For all propane fire bowls, outdoor setup is a breeze. Customers love the hassle-free setup — with propane, there’s no need to hire a contractor to set it up. It’s as easy as unpacking your new fire bowl, heading to Home Depot to buy a propane tank, and lighting your brand new fire pit. 

Here are some of our favorite propane fire bowls for sale.
settings.override_product_description_1: The PyroMania Fire Shangri La Fire Pit is not only beautiful, but it also comes with a free propane hose. Talk about convenience!
settings.override_product_description_2: The Lunar Bowl has a sleek design that’s perfect for any aesthetic. Who wants an unsightly propane tank next to their beautiful new fire bowl?! Luckily, the Lunar comes with a matching propane tank cover — sold separately.
settings.override_product_description_3: The Ecosmart Pod 40 not only has an elegant modern design, but it has a burn time of 8–20 hours with its propane option, ensuring plenty of time for great conversation around the enchanting flames.

settings.title: Concrete Fire Bowls
settings.subheading:
Concrete fire bowls have a wide variety of benefits. Not only is concrete extremely durable, but it’s low maintenance, so it can withstand the elements without wearing down or changing color.

All our concrete fire bowls are made with glass fiber reinforced concrete (GFRC), which is incredibly light and amazingly strong, ensuring that your fire bowl will withstand the test of time. Shop our favorite concrete fire bowls below!
settings.override_product_description_1: The Prism Hardscapes Moderno 5 is made of incredibly high-quality concrete and comes with an impressive 2-year warranty vs. most manufacturers’ typical 1-year warranty.
settings.override_product_description_2: The sleek, modern design of the Sedona Fire Pit will have your guests saying “wow!” the moment they set eyes on it.
settings.override_product_description_3: The Modeno Roca Fire Table is still light enough to be moved by two or three people — just bribe your buddies with a couple pizzas and some beers!

settings.title: Outdoor Fire Bowls
settings.subheading:
When it comes to an outdoor fire bowl, propane is only one of many great options.

You can also purchase outdoor gas fire bowls that will let you enjoy the ambiance of your backyard as late as you want.

Here are the top three outdoor fire bowls for sale.
settings.override_product_description_1: With its extremely high BTU output, the Oasis Series Fire Pit is perfect if you’re in a part of the country where cold means really cold.
settings.override_product_description_2: The Patriot Fire Pit is one heck of a tough fire bowl. This American-made fire bowl was built to withstand the harshest weather conditions.
settings.override_product_description_3: Rainstorms? Snowstorms? The Shangri La Fire Pit could care less! Its color-fast finish will preserve its color no matter what mother nature throws at it.

settings.title: Wood Burning Fire Bowls
settings.subheading:
Looking for a throwback to the fire pit basics? These wood-burning fire pit bowls are for you. All our outdoor wood-burning fire bowls are built tough enough to withstand the high heat of a wood-burning flame while still being beautiful enough to accent any backyard.

Here are some of our favorite outdoor wood-burning fire bowls.
settings.override_product_description_1: The Asia Fire Pit combines a sleek Asian aesthetic with a low-profile design that will make any backyard, patio, or deck shine.
settings.override_product_description_2: Calling all patriots! The Patriot Fire Pit is built in the good ole’ USA and stands tough in any weather.
settings.override_product_description_3: The Lunar Fire Pit is part of the Skillman Signature Series and is shaped like a dazzling crescent moon.

settings.title: Large Fire Bowls
settings.subheading:
Large outdoor fire bowls are perfect for those big backyard gatherings that get the whole neighborhood laughing, drinking, and dancing by the crackling flames late into the night. If you’re looking to install your extra-large fire bowl outdoors, you’ll want to check with your installer to make sure your patio or deck can handle the weight.

Here are our favs.
settings.override_product_description_1: The Pottery Works Fire Pit is as big as fire bowls get and is available in four eye-catching colors.
settings.override_product_description_2: The Moderno Fire Pit comes in a variety of gorgeous colors, including ebony, pewter, café, natural, and ultra white.
settings.override_product_description_3: The 40" Marseille Fire Bowl has a simple-yet-dynamic design, with a reduced profile and wide mouth, allowing you to fill it with more fire media than other options.

settings.title: Small Fire Bowls
settings.subheading:
Looking for something small and sleek to accent your backyard, patio, deck, or even a room inside your home? We’ve got you covered with our large selection of small fire bowls.

Several of our small fire bowls burn bioethanol, which allows them to be placed indoors, bringing that incredible shimmering flame and soft heat into your favorite room.
settings.override_product_description_1: Clocking in at 26.8 inches wide, the Modeno York Fire Bowl packs a big BTU punch in a small package. It’s perfect for city life, where outdoor space is at a premium.
settings.override_product_description_2: The Ecosmart Mix 600 Fire Pit is a unique piece that makes a statement and draws the eye. It might be a little guy at only 17.8 inches high, but it’s perfect for parties of all shapes and sizes.
settings.override_product_description_3: With the clean-burning bioethanol option, the Ecosmart Pod 30 Freestanding Fire Pit is small enough to become the perfect indoor centerpiece. Maybe don’t roast your marshmallows inside though…

settings.title: Metal Fire Bowls
settings.subheading:
Want a rustic-looking metal fire bowl that can handle plenty of heat and burn wood or liquid propane? We’ve got you covered. Metal fire bowls start out gorgeous and get more beautiful over time as they develop a lush, natural patina.

Here are some of the best metal fire bowls for sale.
settings.override_product_description_1: The Ohio Flame Liberty Fire Pit is rustic, rugged, and American-made. It will develop a gorgeous patina over time.
settings.override_product_description_2: The Manta Ray Fire Pit was designed in Tennessee and has HPC’s patented Stainless Steel Penta Burner, ensuring your beautiful fire pit will burn for a lifetime.
settings.override_product_description_3: The Scallop Fire Pit can stand up to the toughest weather conditions. Made of powerful carbon steel, it will develop a beautiful patina over time.

settings.title: Are Fire Bowls Safe?
settings.text: Yes, fire bowls are safe if you take proper precautions. They can even be situated on wooden decks safely, though you need to use protective items like a fire pit heat shield to ensure the surface is protected. You should always have a fire extinguisher handy and make sure your children are educated in fire safety if you decide to buy a fire bowl.

settings.title: Are Fire Bowls Warm?
settings.text: Absolutely! Fire bowls, depending on the model and the fuel source, can put out tens of thousands of BTUs of heat. You can also use products like fire pit deflectors to increase the heat that you and your guests feel.

settings.title: How Much Are Fire Bowls?
settings.text: Depending on a variety of factors, fire bowls can cost anywhere from a few hundred dollars to $6,000, or even more. The highest quality fire bowls are going to be the most expensive, but they’re worth every dollar.

settings.title: Who sells fire bowls and where can I buy fire bowls?
settings.text:
We do! With our massive selection of fire bowls and fire bowl accessories, you’re sure to find the product you need at the price point that makes sense for you.
